article.para: Tags are used to refer to images. A tag forms a part of the image's name. Unlike labels, tags can be freely defined, and they are usually used to indicate a version number.
If a tag exists in multiple images, the newest image is used. The image maintainer decides which tags to assign to the container image.
The conventional tag format is repository name: image version specification (usually version number). For example, the tag for the latest published image of &slea; 15 SP2 would be suse/sle15:15.2.
